tagline: As the legislature has provided for awarding alternative sentence of life imprisonment in case of offence of murder, it would be difficult to hold that death penalty is the normal penalty and should ordinarily be awarded. A single mitigating circumstance, available in a particular case, would be sufficient to put on guard the Judge not to award the penalty of death but life imprisonment. The motive set up in the F.I.R. was not of the degree and magnitude, if at all it did lay with the accused, to take lives of two persons, more so, when the same has remained shrouded in mystery.
